#Text=Peggy J. Kleinplatz

#Text=Peggy Joy Kleinplatz is a Canadian clinical professor , psychologist , and sexologist whose work often concerns optimal sexuality , opposition to the medicalization of human sexuality , and outreach to marginalized groups . [ 1 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=Education
#Text=Peggy Joy Kleinplatz graduated from University of Ottawa with a B.A. ( Honours ) in Psychology in 1981 and Ph.D. in 1987 . [ 3 ]
#Text=Her dissertation was titled The impact of gender-role identity , conformity and choice on women 's self-esteem , lifestyle satisfaction and conflict .
#Text=Kleinplatz 's doctoral advisor was Michael McCarrey . [ 4 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Kleinplatz is a full Professor of Medicine and Clinical Professor of Psychology at the University of Ottawa . [ 3 ]
#Text=Kleinplatz is a certified clinical psychologist and sex therapist and has taught human sexuality for over 20 years at the University of Ottawa . [ 5 ]
#Text=She is an Adjunct Research Professor at Carleton University . [ 6 ]
#Text=She has also held the Chair of Ethics and the Chair of Certifications for the American Association of Sexuality Educators , Counsellors and Therapists ( AASECT ) . [ 7 ]
#Text=Kleinplatz and physician Charles Allen Moser argue that paraphilias should be removed from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( DSM ) . [ 8 ]
#Text=Kleinplatz wrote , " [ T]he DSM criteria for diagnosis of unusual sexual interests as pathological rests on a series of unproven and more importantly , untested assumptions .

#Text=Therapists who focus on  functional " versus " dysfunctional " sex , have an approach , she writes that " is , at best , limiting and constraining and , at worst , dehumanising and risks exacerbating rather than alleviating suffering .

#Text=Kleinplatz criticized sex therapy as being  too performance oriented , " and not focusing enough on desire . [ 11 ]

column1: #Text=Her work has been to focus more on ways that partners can please one another by learning to listen to what their partners want . [ 12 ] [ 13 ]
#Text=Kleinplatz has shown that " great sex flourishes in relationships that deepen with maturity , " according to the Globe and Mail . [ 14 ]
#Text=She has also criticized the concepts premenstrual dysphoric disorder [ 15 ] and dyspareunia as medicalizing women 's bodies . [ 16 ]

#Text=Her book , New Directions in Sex Therapy : Innovations and Alternatives ( 2001 ) , was considered by the Journal of Sex & Marital Therapy to be an important challenge to current models of sex therapy . [ 17 ]
#Text=The book is also a feminist critique of sex therapy and describes modern issues facing the practice . [ 18 ]
#Text=The second edition came out in 2012 and it was updated and expanded . [ 19 ]
#Text=New Directions in Sex Therapy ( 2nd edition ) was a co-winner for an AASECT award in 2013 . [ 7 ]
#Text=Her book , Sadomasochism : Powerful Pleasures ( 2006 ) , examines fifteen in-depth cases of different types of couples who practices sadomasochism . [ 20 ]
#Text=Awards and honors
#Text=Kleinplatz was awarded the Prix d'excellence at University of Ottawa . [ 3 ]
